comment: Spicy and sweet.  Great bourbon for rye lovers looking for something a little more spicy.
Good stuff. A bit strong. I drank an entire bottle in one sitting. No regrets.
Nice sweetness for a rye-heavy mash bill.
I had this, but wasn't totally blown away by it. Did taste a bit like a Tennessee whiskey to me actually.

The bill on this bourbon is heavy on the rye and it shows. The vanilla is one of the first scents you'll encounter on the nose, but it crispens with some orange in your mouth and finishes in a kick of spices that trail down your throat, leaving heat. There's also a bit of roughness at the end. This is a nice bourbon, but it just didn't wow me.
Very good sipping bourbon. I'll enjoy all of it but it didn't jump out at me either.
Very smooth and sweet drinking bourbon.  I was surprised how good it was...I'll definitely buy again!
Drank at JAMF after my second try at getting my CCTV certification.. Recommended by Josh Toro
For the price you can't get a smoother, layered whisky. Sweet, caramel ending that makes for a great Manhatten.
Donnie brought this back from Tennessee. It was a decent whiskey that had a strong alcohol smell to it but tasted very sweet, almost like caramel.
Light and airy with a very nice spice to it that finishes hard on the tip of the tongue.
Rich, oily, syrupy. Sugary sweet, honey, toffee, and a little pepper.

This is a very nice bourbon. Different enough that it is a must have for any collection. On the nose, I get the traditional caramel, vanilla, and oak but then you throw in a clove, orange, and nutmeg combination. Not overpowering, but a great nose. On the palate, this one has a great texture. It is sweet up front due to the orange, clove, and rye spices. Then comes the traditional vanilla and oak for the finish with a touch of cinnamon spice. 91/100.
Tried it in Nashville and it tasted kind of like boozy maple syrup. Enjoyed it overall. Even got it in a Manhattan that Kate liked
Vanilla nose and extremely smooth mouth feel. One of my favorite bourbons on the market. 4.5/5

A good bourbon with elevated rye content. Nose has very medicinal scents with light notes of vanilla and orange. Body is warm and sweet with good hits of caramel with slight hints to dark bitter chocolate. Finish is spicy and lingers very well.
Reminds me of a Bulleit but smoother. Light & refreshing.
Solid bourbon.  Worth putting on the shelf
It has a creamy, vanilla-toffee smell. Sipping it, you get a spicy vanilla toffee flavor that heats up as it sits in the mouth. It has a lingering, smooth heat at the end. A great summer sipper.
Very good.  Has a hint of hot sauce type flavor.  Burns.  Good smell.
Pretty balanced bourbon with light notes of fruit and some spice. Enjoyable, could definitely sip on this. Especially at this price.
Bar tender made a mistake...I didn't mean to order this.   Franklin Room
Caramel, peppery, long after taste with slight leather. Not as smooth as the Cognac finish. May need to let the bottle sit for awhile after opening. *Definately improved after opening the bottle.
Light, sweet and smooth on palate. Slight spice on the way down with a little anise after taste.
A welcome spicy note that lingers at the end. Savory and riveting. This isn't a lazy bourbon by any means. It starts strong and ends strong with a brilliant liveliness to it. (FWF share #20)
Light and sweet.  Only gentle vanilla toffee on the front end, then slowly warms with a spicy finish and lingering tannin.

Nose: vanilla, Carmel, wood, a little heat
Palate: smooth and sweet hint of spice
Finish: smooth, spicy burn
Wow!!! I really enjoy this the rye spice is just right with the age the put out ! Definitely a huge fan of their products they've picked great MGP barrels!
not my cup of Tennessee tea. sour mash is what they term astringent. leather is not my flavor either. do not but again.
Nice amount of Rye spice, good sipping bourbon. Could be good for cocktail.

$39

One of my favorites. Very well balanced and a great sipper. Definitely a buy and one to have for the collection.
Cereal grains. Sweet, but its got a little spicy. Finish is dry. Medium length. Quite grainy.

Smooth and a bit sweet with a a lot of spice upfront. 
—————////————
Liquor Barn Richmond rd, Lexington KY
10/21/2017
$41
Nose - Dried fruit. Taste - Sweet Carmel corn, oak,
had on the tour...nice smooth bourbon but definitely wasn't blown away
Nose: berries, plums, a little bit of peanut butter. Taste: plums, pears, and sour berries and grapes on the finish along with burnt wood.
Definitely more spice than sweet, but a good value for the price. I’d probably still pick a Rittenhouse or similar if I was looking for a spice, but it’s worth trying.
Solid bourbon, but a little to hot
The first of the five tastings while on the tour. This was the second best (behind the 2 yr reserve at the end). Nutty and hearty aromas
Nice nose, fruit and honey. On the palate, bitterness up front, sweet fruit and a bit of astringent oak. Some vanilla. Feels creamy. Cacao nibs lingers for a bit. 6/2/18
Very good bourbon. A good substitute for Blanton’s if you’re a fan but can’t get you hands on it.
citrus front with strong maple and rye spice into a long warm finish
Simply a great example a full rich American bourbon.
a spicy bourbon, without much sweetness
I like this a lot. seanmom and Raddad brought a bottle back from Nashville
Nice pour, not overly complex but tasty enough to forgive
3.5 out of 5. Nothing overwhelmingly good or bad. Perhaps best for mixing for an old fashion.
my favourite bourbon! smooth, mellow, subtle hints of vanilla, clean finish
A solid great bourbon. Not special just solid. Great everyday after work drink. It gets delicious as the ice melts too, which is strange because most 90 proof bourbons suck after being watered down.
Tastes like honey with a little more body than some bourbon. Both of us liked it.
Very full and sweet at the same time. Not usually a big fan of bends but this is fantastic.
very nice, smooth and flavorful bourbon
Finishing off a bottle... this is really good for the $$$. Moving on to their 11yr special edition... which is even better !!!
Very balanced spicy and vanilla flavor, with a not too sweet scent.
Orange- good for an old fashioned possibly
A spicy bourbon, tastes like a rye!
The best MGP sourced bourbon blend I have tasted so far. The folks at Nelson's Greenbrier know how to pick good barrels.
Good balance of spicy and sweet. Spice forward and subtle sweet nutty burn. Taste of caramel, wood, vanilla and walnut.
Nice and tasty. Will drink more of this!

Pour: neat in glen cairn

Nose: (4.0) Oak and honey dominate with a bit of toffee and ethanol.

Palate: (4.5) I hate to use the term but it is incredibly smooooooth.  Almost no bite.  Tastes of traditional caramel and vanilla are out front with hint of pepper.    The fact that it is not complex but very traditional bourbon speaks to me.

Finish: (4.0) Could have been longer on the finish as it offered nice fruit and a creamy nougat like finish.  Dont expect alot of spice but just enough keeps it intetesting to go back for a second glass.

Overall:  At 39.99 this is a certain winner.  It makes me want to sample the Madiera and Cognac finishes BUT hard to step up to the 79.99 price tag.  Enjoy this one for $40 less until the fancy ones come down.  A solid bourbon to my collection

The nose is typical bourbon-vanilla, oak, caramel sweet. It’s best with a little bit of added water, yielding a citrus sweetness, a little anise, and a slight oily mouth feel that leads to a peppery rye finish. The sweetness lingers. This is a very nice whiskey!
Sweetness on the nose with slight pepper. Tastes of Carmel and vanilla with lasting heat and some spice. 95/100
Opens up with a little water to vanilla, gingerbread, and rye spice. A very nice whiskey.
Taste from Charlie. Sweet and spicy.
harsh after taste but definite notes of Carmel and vanilla

Nose is caramel, leather, orange

More leather on the palate, with some oak and anise, not super sweet. 

Medium finish, I’m a fan though
It’s pretty good. Love the Nashville whiskey, but prefer it more in an old fashioned.

Nose:
Standard bourbon nose +
Baking spice heavy
Concentrated orange, like a liquer

Taste:
Pinecone 
Not unpleasant oak bite
Dark chocolate that dissolves into spiciness
Full mouthfeel, but not heavy

I'm really suprised.  Good for the price. I added some ice and water which opened it up more than expected. 

Very smooth finish. will buy this again.

Spreads like a caramel on your tongue with a little spice of Rye.
Perfect for the Rye lovers!
Very spicy straight up. With water and ice it’s smooth and delicious.
Leathery, with sweet caramel and cinnamon, spice and pepper that sits on your tongue.

Aroma: Very fruity (kiwi, lychee, apple)
Placement: lips, tip, sides
Body: Good body
Tasting notes: black pepper, cherry, basil, wood, fruit
Finish: Sour

The Bourbon is pretty spicy! Lots of cinnamon and nutmeg and something like cloves? Also a decent bit of corn sweetness, and vanilla. Not too much alcohol burn. Lingers just a bit, with anise and cinnamon.
Very nice.  A narrow flavor profile but enjoyable
Honey bomb! Lots of citrus and smooth. Open bottle at Woodlake Tavern
Old leather, stronger, very old smelling
Flight; Mourvedre Finish. Smooth. Soft. Still a bite.
2 ice cubes and let it sit for a few minutes and it is really good.
After letting it breathe, it became even better.

Thanks to @GeologyJack for giving a generous pour , I actually was able to do a bit of an experiment with this as well as having it the standard way.  I had half of it with a few drops of water.  Aroma is pretty good...circus caramel corn.  Taste is a bit oaky, which I translated to a pretty decent age (maybe 5-9?).  But has again that caramel corn sweetness.  It’s a great bourbon to share with friends and family—-just don’t go expecting a hard punch of power like Elijah Craig BP, or complexity like a Four Roses LESB.  It’s fairly one dimensional but it does it well.  

Now the fun part.  I was making saffron cheesecake today, and I took some of the base for an experiment with the second half of the pour. I made a bit of saffron liquer ( honey, vanilla, cinnamon, saffron, peppercorn in water ) and mixed it as 3 / 1 ratio bourbon / saffron.  Wow.  Talk about complexity!  I got a layer of sweetness from the saffron on top of the bourbon’s inherent sweetness, but a different type from the saffron.  The saffron added almost an herbal sweetness, as opposed to the sugary sweetness from the corn base in bourbon.  And this was then tempered by the cinnamon and peppercorn heat.   I need to replicate that small batch 1 ounce experiment to a larger batch when friends are over.

Found this about 5 years ago while in Nashville. I love it! Interesting story if you take the time to look it up. Very easy drinking and also good if you infuse it with peach per their website. Great neat or on the rocks! When in Nashville be sure to take the distillery tour and learn more of the history.
Smooth, without any bite on the back end.
Semi sweet but nice candied fruit taste. Very good on the rocks.
Medicinal flavor like cough syrup followed by a leathery note and then a mild barrel punch.

Color: bronze. 
Nose: honey,sweet tea, speyside scotch, banana, leather, did I just smell playdough?, Carmel. 
Palate: honey up front but quickly gets spicy- touch of cinnamon, pepper, a bit of must/leather-definitely the rye poking through 
Solid dram
Good neat, better over a cube or with a couple drops of water. Smooth, classic bourbon taste. A little spice on the finish.

Smells intensely of caramel syrup, like the kind you'd put on your ice cream or in your coffee. The taste is certainly caramel through and through, although not as concentrated as it smells. The rye takes over for most of the tasting, and the finish smooths out with candy and sugar. The finish, like the tasting, is a bit weak, which is a tad disappointing for the age, but the caramel lingers just a millisecond past everything else, leaving you with a decent bourbon.
Complex, nutty, classic bourbon flavors, but deeper. Writing from memory over a year ago but this was in my favourite bourbon at the time.

Rested 15 minutes. Served neat in a Glencairn. 

Nose - vanilla, caramel, cinnamon
Palette - silky palette with vanilla and sweet corn on the front. 
Finish - a quick burn with some black pepper notes and then sweet corn on the back end. 

Pretty solid but nothing special honestly.

Another solid, well rounded Bourbon yet not available in OK. 
Nose & Palate present with a caramel corn & vanilla sweetness yet with plenty of spice to keep from being cloying. A very nice dram to pair with a cigar as it doesn’t overpower or bow out.
Good, but just too spicy for me. Obviously should have read the flavor profile here first. If you are down for that, you will like this. Reminds me of a more spicy Buffalo Trace.

Nose: Vanilla, Barrel Spice, Rye Spice, Carmel, Citrus, Black Tea

Taste: Vanilla, Black Licorice, Carmel, Earthy, Tea, Baking Spices
Rich and full bodied with vanilla and caramel. Not much bite but a very nice sipper before moving on to wilder stuff.

Aroma: Vanilla and caramel

Taste: Sweet and Spicy 

Aftertaste: Spice at the end but not over powering.
Citrusy. Hits the front of the pallet hard. Not a fan.

It’s delicious, sweet, and memorable. My biggest problem with this bourbon is that it’s overpriced for what it is. It’s very good, but it’ll be hard for me to buy another bottle when I can find more interesting things in the 40$ range. However, I recommend that everyone buy a bottle at least once because it is quite smooth and complex.
A favorite Tennessee whiskey. Seriously smooth and tasty.
This one is growing on me. I was expecting something different. But what it has going on is getting better after every tasting. I guess I know more of what to expect and can enjoy it.

Fantastic nose with lots of sweet vanilla.  Very woody and herbal on the palate.  A lot of oak, some spiciness- a bit of black pepper.  Very dry and astringent.  I taste a lot of woody barrel flavor.  Long, dry, oak finish.
Really like for making an Old Fashioned!

This is a straight forward, spicy, but easy ride.  I highly recommend for a warm-up drink or a first of the night pour.  It has just enough fruity and floral notes to keep it interesting, but not enough to make it a completely balanced and boring drink.  Like a few other bourbons I have run across, it is different enough from my go-to drinks to make it appealing.  After a bit of analysis, it has a similar flavor profile to the Willett bottles I have tried???  Unfortunately, while available in VA and SC, it is still a no-go in NC.  This would be a STEAL at ~$30-35.  Unfortunately, it is $45 plus the obligatory confiscatory kick to the "man".  This makes it a $50 bottle which I think is a bit of a stretch.  However, I plan to keep a bottle around to prevent taste bud attrition.
Minimal finish,  brown sugar burnt sweet
So smooth with the vanilla and caramel notes really popping out. Okay and pine finish.
Great bottle. Unique nose and great flavor. Highly recommend.
Burn throughout to distract from flavor.  Water or ice would make a nice drinker
Sweet and spicy, as suggested. Smooth with a somewhat sharp alcohol bite.

I think Amanda got it right.  Nosing reveals typical sweet scents of vanilla, a bit of Maple, honey, light caramel and wood. Holding it on the tongue it is quite sweet with similar flavors revealed if you can hold it long enough, even the magic coconut. Upon swallow the spice is very nice, typically on the outer edges of the tongue and a slight burn to the throat. At 90.4 proof, this is a toss it down whiskey, if one were of a mind to do so, which I rarely ever do. Just seems a waste of good flavor. But people drink in different ways and for different reasons. I really like easy drinkin' Bourbons like this and will be searching for other Belle Meade whiskeys for sure. Next up the Sherry cask.

 $35.99 in close-by MD. $45 in PA.
Delicious.  Smooth start and a lasting but good heat finish.
Very smooth and easy drinking, heavy on the sweet.
Love love love me some belle meade. It’s a higher rye bourbon and has heavier leather notes balanced with apricots and cherries. This is a very enjoyable sipper, sip it neat and do yourself a favor:)

Nose- caramel, oak, maybe cherry
Palate- spicy then sweet with a fast finish.
Had a great mix of spice and sweet, starts hot but had a great finish
Had a little bite so throwing it on a big ice cube. Tastes of orange peels and vanilla, overall not bad for $35.
Sweet, smooth, rich vanilla, not very Smokey

Nose is sweet. Cherry pie with vanilla and grain notes.

Palate is oily and thick. Brown sugar.

Spicy finish with cacao and black tea.

Damn good Bourbon. Not too super complex but very good.
Fantastic. Orange, caramel, brown sugar on the nose. Sweet taste...vanilla, orange peel, and something else. spicy, peppery finish. Good lingering heat. Great bourbon.
Very spicy yet not one dimensional. Sweet vanilla and cocoa coming in second. Yum.
Caramel corn and slight leather on the nose. Sweet on the first sip then finishes spicy and peppery from the rye.

Smooth, starts out a bit thin but lingers nicely, ok spice - an easy drink 

Vanilla on the nose, scent of charcoal (softer than four roses), fruity flavor disappears into rye, slight campfire marshmallow carmel flavor - not bad, priced ok

Got this on sale for $ 38 been wanting to try for long time. Its aged 6-8 years and is high rye bourbon. Its actually 30% which is higher than most. Here's what Greenbrier says...... “To ensure that no other Bourbon in the world tastes like Belle Meade Bourbon, we created a proprietary blend using two different high-rye content mash bills and two complementary yeast strains from barrels aged between 6 to 8 years. Each batch of our proprietary blend consists of just 4 barrels and creates the signature flavor profile that makes Belle Meade Bourbon the award-winning Bourbon of choice for the discerning whiskey drinker.”   Here's what I say.....Poured neat, nice amber color and good glasscoat. Nose leaps out of glass with spicy caramel, black cherries, old leather, dusty books and wood with brown sugar. Kinda reminds me of a sweeter more vibrant Bulleit. Thick oily mouthfeel brings palate of bold rye, melted butter, spicy oak and rich cherry vanilla. Has a note to it that reminds me of cherry pop rocks or Dr Pepper. Some nice heat but not harsh. Its aggressive but balanced. Finish is lingering polished wood and cinnamon with cola fading to dry heavy oak. Initially I didn't feel it warranted an elite score but after some time enjoying the bottle I quite like it.... its different. This is sourced from mgp but the aging and blending has vastly influenced this bourbon imo. The oily texture and combo of sweet and spicy has won me over .........90/100... yes its a little overpriced but I don't care, its bursting with flavor and has a unique profile. Will need to get some of the special cask finishes now......(have since purchased 3 pack 375ml of all three cask finish versions...reviews to follow)
Very smooth, long taste. Didn’t think it was particularly spicy, but enjoyed the sweetness.
Very good bourbon. Licorice nose, sweet early meets spice and longer finish at the end. Good, better than most
Carmel, vanilla, sweet... easy to sip!
Very approachable. Sweet up front that stays with you as some burn comes in and then a very spicy finish with a good deal of heat.
Strong caramel at the beginning. Finished with smooth leather.

Price:**1/2 bought for $50 which is about average but a little above price for the quality, proof, and source of the bourbon but about on par for the artisanal and craft aspect of the whiskey
Nose: **1/2 cinnamon, brown sugar, high alcohol, and slight vanilla
Palate: **** classic bourbon taste with hot red hot candy taste, cinnamon, brown sugar, and vanilla oak.
Finish: ***1/2 medium

It has a vanilla and caramel smell that is pretty strong.  Thick mouthfeel hits you hard with spicy oak and bold rye.  It’s got some heat so be ready but not too harsh. Finish is lingering oak and cinnamon.  It’s 30% rye so that explains it!

Belle Meade has become one of my favorite go to distilleries. This is my first bottle of the sour mash. Nose is sweet like southern candied yams. Taste is full bodied honey and cinnamon forward with a red hot burn that lingers to an almost creamy smooth finish. Not my favorite BM product, but still a nice dram.

Belle Meade Bourbon

APPEARANCE: I like the classic looking bottle shape and label. It's fairly light in color and clings like glue to the sides of the Glencairn with fat slow moving legs.
NOSE: Complex. Shapeshifting. Initial impression is Woody, Dry, Spicy, and Floral. Freshly Peeled Orange, Dried Corn, Cedar, Bubble Gum, and Chocolate all take a turn. This is one of those I could nose all day. The Orange note eventually takes center stage. The empty glass is sweet hay that transitions to milk chocolate. If the palate lives up to the nose, this one is special.
NEAT: Drying Oak, Orange Peel, and Tingling Black Pepper Spice dominate the first few sips. Slightly Oily, Coating mouthfeel. There is a Bubble Gum sweetness, mild at first but growing stronger the more time you spend with it. It has a Spicy, Slightly Astringent finish with Orange Peel, Cocoa and Cedar coating the palate. A mild Building KY Hug blooms in the chest. 
SPLASH: Ups the complexity. The Oak on the palate becomes sweeter, the astringency  mostly gone now. There are Floral notes and some Vanilla finally emerges and combines with the citrus to form Orange Creamsicle. The Oak and Black Pepper continue to layer on the palate with each sip. 

Verdict: I really like this one. Unique profile. It starts dry and spicy, then transitions to a Citrus/Floral sweet if you give it time to develop.  I hesitated to spend the $50 on this, but I'm glad I did. This is definitely going into heavy rotation.
Extremely balanced, sweet up front with spice on the medium finish. Great “all around” bourbon
Smooth on the tongue with a slight build of heat that lingers but does not overpower the experience. Mellow slight vanilla undertone which leaves your mouth watering for the next...😉😏
One week later, sipping with a large ice ball. It’s everything you want in bourbon. Sweet but good bourbon taste and at least a medium finish length. Need another bottle
Strong alcohol taste which I like. Vanilla, orange, leather, and rye spiciness and pepper. One of my favorites so far in this price range.
